titleStmt.title: Puritano-Iesuitismus, the Puritan turn'd Jesuite; or rather, out-vying him in those diabolicall and dangerous positions, of the deposition of kings; from the yeare 1536. untill this present time; extracted out of the most ancient and authentick authours. By that reverend divine, Doctour Ovven, Batchelour of Divinity. Shewing their concord in the matter, their discord in the manner of their sedition.
Herod and Pilate reconciled
titleStmt.author: Owen, David, d. 1623.

titleStmt.title: Puritano-Iesuitismus, the Puritan turn'd Jesuite; or rather, out-vying him in those diabolicall and dangerous positions, of the deposition of kings; from the yeare 1536. untill this present time; extracted out of the most ancient and authentick authours. By that reverend divine, Doctour Ovven, Batchelour of Divinity. Shewing their concord in the matter, their discord in the manner of their sedition.
Herod and Pilate reconciled
titleStmt.author: Owen, David, d. 1623.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Sheares, at the signe of the Bible in Covent-garden,

notesStmt.note: Originally published in 1610 as: Herod and Pilate reconciled.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
